I'm just gonna start off with the cons and I have four major complaints

1. The game is incredibly buggy and sometimes basic game mechanics fail to function. For example even the simple action of grabbing a survivor is so inconsistent that survivor players can abuse it to get the killer temporarily stuck in the animation while they run away.

2. The game is horrifically unbalanced and sometimes skill is thrown entirely out the window. Many perks tend to be completely useless while only a few are so powerful that the entire meta revolves around them. Killers are similarly unbalanced but BHVR seems to be working on the balance of the game so this might age poorly. Speaking of BHVR.

3. BHVR is not very good at listening to the community and it often takes them weeks or sometimes even months to fix things that gamebreaking. Some people might not think that this is a problem with the game but it directly effects the game so I say it's a criticism to be made.

4. This game has quite a few microtransactions and dlc. While you can wait for the killers, survivors and perks to be available for in game currency it's very likely you will either have to wait an immense amount of time or use quite a lot of cash to get all the content.

That all being said this game is probably one of the most unique multiplayer games I've ever touched. Both sides are fun and mostly stay interesting with some generator riddled exceptions. While the game can sometimes fuck you over that doesn't mean you can't get immensely skilled at the game. I can also appreciate the perks which you can interchange between survivors and killers since they can completely change how you play them. I also find of most of the maps fun with only a few that lean too hard into one sides favour. However if you came into this wanting to play a multiplayer horror game you probably won't come out too satisfied. The scare factor tends to wear off after you've realised how all the killers work and only a few of them like The Hag and some stealth killers ever make me jump anymore. Overall this game is kind of like videogame fast food to me. Yeah it's a buggy unbalanced mess of virtual entertainment and if I went on about it for longer I definitely could have found plenty more flaws but at the end of the day it's such a unique and fun experience that I can't not recommend this game and the price of admission isn't too high either as long as we don't factor in the microtransactions. If you've got the money get the base game at least.
说实话，不推荐给新手玩家，因为对于新手玩家这个游戏真的不是很友好，每个人和屠夫都要升级，那就意味着你想玩另一个人或者屠夫就要重头开始升级，因为好的技能都在后面，而因为是新手既没有技能又没有操作，基本上是挨打，或者拖累队友。而且，新手屠夫基本上排不到玩家。另外，还很吃地图的熟悉度。我这种菜逼，基本上是乱晃了。另外，没买的dlc，你不熟悉屠夫技能也难受。哈哈哈。我是菜逼，大佬们可以无视这个评论。

There's a lot to like about this game. It can be a fairly decent party game, especially during this time of year, with the pandemic going on. There's plenty of characters, with their own unique perks to play as. I really appreciate the roster the killers provide, even going as far as integrating certain licensed characters into the game. I'm absolutely thankful for full controller support, as I have trouble with mouse and keyboard (bad wrist). If a symmetrical horror/survival/hide&seek style of play is your thing, I'd highly recommend this title.
